oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate bond
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-thousand-dollar Confederate States of America bond, No. 2550, 7 per cent. The bond was to be paid July 1, 1868. One of the eight cash-in stubs has been removed. At the center of the certificate is an engraving of Lt. General T. J. [Stonewall] Jackson. The oval image is flanked on both sides with the dollar amount, $1000, and certificate number. Below the text is a small engraving of a steamboat.
